moves.4. Nc3 Bd6 5. Nd5 Qg6 6. O-O Nge7: I'm not sure why he did'nt play Qxe4.
moves.7. Nc3 b6 8. Re1 a5 9. d4 O-O 10. Bxc6 N: This was supposed to be a trap. Bxe3 leads to Ne7  capturing the queen, and securing the win.
moves.15... c6 16. Nh4: The move i should have played was Nf4, which saves the knight and the rook from getting captured, but since i did not observe well the position, i saw the worst move and played it.
moves.16... Qg5 17. Nf3: Attacking the queen to make my oponent waste time...
moves.17... Qh6 18. Re4: I prefered to lose a knight because i was planing an attack on the king after that by using the rook.
moves.18... cxd5 19. Rh4 Qg6 20. Qxd5: He forgot to save the pawn, which could have meant the difference between wining or losing.
moves.21. Qc4 Ba6 22. Qf4 f6 23. Rg4 Qxc2: I think this is a bad move, since it leaves his king wide open for an attack.
moves.25. exf6 Qxf2+ 26. Kh1 Be3: The final mistake, he should have played something like d6, which should have protected his king for a longer period of time. I think.
moves.27... Kf8 28. Rxh7+: A move which leads to a beautiful forced mate. The variations are Bxh6, followed by Rh8#, and the one he played.
moves.28... Ke8 29. Rh8+: Checkmate after black moves Rf8, I would have played Qxf8# or Rxf8#.
